Article Title: Virat Kohli‚Äôs RCB teammate pens heartfelt message after Amit Mishra's controversial statements
Article Text:
(Credit: Yash Dayal's Instagram)

NEW DELHI: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) fast-bowler Yash Dayal took to social media to express his admiration and respect for Virat Kohli , the former Indian captain.Dayal's heartfelt message came in the wake of controversial statements made by former Indian leg-spinner Amit Mishra , who alleged that Kohli's aggressive nature has led to him having fewer friends and that it was Kohli who had instigated a rift with Afghanistan cricketer Naveen-ul-Haq during an IPL match between RCB and Lucknow Super Giants (LSG).In his Instagram post, Dayal shared a picture with Kohli, captioning it, "It's an honour to stand beside you, bhaiya @virat.kohli."Furthermore, Dayal shared the post on his Instagram story, using audio from Kohli's final game as RCB captain. In the background, Kohli can be heard saying, "I have given my best. I don't know how the response has been, but I have given 120 percent to this franchise every time, which is something I will now do as a player."In an appearance on YouTuber Shubhankar Mishra‚Äôs show "Unplugged," Amit Mishra commented, ‚ÄúHe (Kohli) started abusing our players (in the LSG vs RCB rematch in Lucknow). He didn‚Äôt have any grudges with Kyle Mayers, but he abused him as well. Naveen-ul-Haq was bowling, and he abused him too. A lot could have been avoided, but Kohli chose not to."Mishra further added, ‚ÄúFor social media, it all seemed to be over between them. But do you think Naveen will ever respect Kohli again? What about the youngsters who witnessed a big star abusing others?‚ÄùMeanwhile, Kohli has been enjoying a well-deserved break after India's title-winning campaign in the 2024 T20 World Cup . Recently, he was attending a kirtan (musical chanting of the name of God) led by Krishna Das at Union Chapel in London, accompanied by his wife, Anushka Sharma .
Article Summary: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) fast-bowler Yash Dayal took to social media to express his admiration and respect for Virat Kohli. Dayal's heartfelt message came in the wake of controversial statements made by former Indian leg-spinner Amit Mishra. Mishra alleged that Kohli's aggressive nature has led to him having fewer friends.

Article Title: With 4 golds, India posts best show at maths olympiad
Article Text: MUMBAI: The Indian team of six high school students has achieved a historic feat at the International Mathematics Olympiad (IMO) 2024 , securing the best ever performance since India's debut in 1989.Rushil Mathur, Ananda Bhaduri, Adhitya Ganesh, and Kanav Talwar clinched four gold medals for India, while Arjun Gupta secured a silver medal and Siddharth Choppara received an honourable mention.The team, led by Professor Krishnan Sivasubramanian (IIT-Bombay) and Rijul Saini (former IMO medallist; from Homi Bhabha Centre For Science Education, or HBCSE) as the deputy leader, finished fourth among 108 participating countries, with over 609 students in the competition.The Indian team scored an impressive 167 points, just one mark behind South Korea, with the US, China, and South Korea taking the top three spots. This outstanding performance marks India's best result in the Olympiad in terms of medals won and rank attained, surpassing the previous best rankings of 7th in 2001 and 1998.For each team member, mathematics is their primary passion. Rushil Mathur from Powai, who will pursue mathematics and computer science at the University of Oxford for his undergraduate studies, shared his love for the subject, stating, "While I always enjoyed mathematics as a middle-schooler, I was first introduced to its vastness and beauty when I began preparing for the mathematics Olympiad. The thrill of solving Olympiad problems hooked me onto maths."PM Modi congratulated the 2024 team on their remarkable achievement via a post on X, calling them an inspiration to young people.
Article Summary: The Indian team of six high school students has achieved a historic feat at the International Mathematics Olympiad (IMO) 2024. The team, led by Professor Krishnan Sivasubramanian (IIT-Bombay) and Rijul Saini (former IMO medallist), finished fourth among 108 participating countries, with over 609 students in the competition.

Article Title: 'If India don't want to come to Pakistan, we will...': Hasan Ali reacts to reports that India may skip Champions Trophy in Pakistan
Article Text:
Indian Cricketers Pakistan aana Chahty Hain | Hassan Ali Ny Bari Baat kar Di | Zor Ka Jor | SamaaTV

NEW DELHI: Pakistan all-rounder Hasan Ali has voiced his reaction to the possibility of India not travelling to Pakistan for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.In an interview with Pakistan's Samaa TV, Ali echoed the sentiment of the Pakistan Cricket Board ( PCB ), asserting that if the Champions Trophy is set to be held in Pakistan, it will indeed take place there, and the tournament could go on without India."If we're going there (to India) to play, then they should come to Pakistan too. A lot of people have said countless times that sports should stay away from politics. But if you look at it from another angle, many Indian players have said in interviews that they want to play in Pakistan. So it doesn't mean that the team doesn't want to come; they definitely do. But obviously, they have their own policies, country, and board to consider," the medium-pacer said.Underlining that India's absence may not stop Pakistan from hosting the tournament, he added: "As our chairman has already said, if the Champions Trophy is going to be held in Pakistan, then it will be in Pakistan. If India don't want to come, we'll play without them. Cricket should be played in Pakistan, and if India don't want to participate, it doesn't mean cricket has ended. There are many other teams besides India."Reports suggest that theIndian cricket team may not travel to Pakistan for the tournament due to ongoing political tensions. The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is reportedly considering requesting the International Cricket Council (ICC) to move their matches to Sri Lanka or Dubai.The Champions Trophy is scheduled to take place in Pakistan between February and March 2025. India have not played a bilateral series in Pakistan since the 2008 Asia Cup due to strained political relations. The last series between the two teams was hosted in India from December 2012 to January 2013. Since then, their encounters have been limited to ICC tournaments and Asia Cups.Pakistan won the ICC Champions Trophy in 2017, while India claimed the title in 2013, adding to their 2002 win when they shared the trophy with Sri Lanka.
Article Summary: Pakistan all-rounder Hasan Ali has voiced his reaction to the possibility of India not travelling to Pakistan for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. India have not played a bilateral series in Pakistan since the 2008 Asia Cup due to strained political relations. The last series between the two teams was hosted in India from December 2012 to January 2013.

Article Title: Mohammed Shami breaks silence on rumours about marriage with Sania Mirza, says ...
Article Text: NEW DELHI: India‚Äôs star pacer Mohammed Shami has finally addressed the swirling rumours about his supposed marriage to tennis star Sania Mirza . Following Sania‚Äôs divorce from former Pakistan cricketer Shoaib Malik , various social media speculations suggested that Shami and Mirza were about to tie the knot.In a recent YouTube interview with Shubhankar Mishra, Shami dismissed the rumours and criticized those spreading false information.‚ÄúAjeeb hi hai. Aur hai kya usme. Jabardasti ki khabar hai. Kuch nahi photo kholo to apna hi photo dikhta hai usme. Kya karenge aap. But mai ek hi cheez bolna chahunga kisi ko nahi khichna chaiye aisa. Mai maanta hun aapke mazaak ke liye memes honge wo lekin kisi ki life se related hote hain. [It‚Äôs quite strange. And what‚Äôs more, it‚Äôs all fabricated news. When you open the photo, it‚Äôs just your own photo that shows up. What can we do now? But I want to say that no one should drag others down like this. I understand there are memes made for humor, but they relate to someone‚Äôs life],‚Äù Shami said.‚ÄúAap Ko bade soch samajh ke wo memes banane chahiye. Dusre ki taang khichna ya dusre ko gaddhe mein dhakelna bada aasaan hai. Thoda success banke dikha. Thoda success achieve karke dikha. Thoda apne level ko upar karke dikhao. Thoda apni family ka saath pakad ke dikhao. Jitna uss badtameezi mein samajh mein aa raha hai na aapko ya taang khichne mein, utna kisi ki help karke dikhao na. Tab mai maanunga aap ache insaan ho. [You should create those memes responsibly. It‚Äôs easy to pull someone‚Äôs leg or push them into a pit. Show some success. Achieve something yourself. Elevate your own level a bit. Support your family. If you understand the rudeness of putting others down, then try helping someone instead. Only then will I believe you are a good person],‚Äù he added.Regarding the recent retirements of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli from T20I cricket, Shami expressed his surprise and acknowledged the challenge of filling their shoes.After India‚Äôs victory in the 2024 T20 World Cup, where they defeated South Africa by seven runs at Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, Kohli was named Player of the Match for his 76 off 59 balls and announced it was his final T20I. Kohli ended his T20I career as India‚Äôs second-highest run-scorer with 4,188 runs in 125 matches at an average of 48.69 and a strike rate of 137.04.Shortly after, Rohit Sharma also announced his retirement from T20Is, finishing as the format's highest run-scorer with 4,231 runs in 159 matches and holding the record for the most centuries in men‚Äôs T20Is.‚ÄúThe retirement of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli from T20Is was a shock. They have been stalwarts for India, delivering outstanding performances and earning their titles as kings of white-ball cricket. Their simultaneous retirement is surprising, but it‚Äôs part of the natural cycle‚Äîwhen one player leaves, another steps in. Replacing such stars will be a significant challenge,‚Äù Shami said.‚ÄúBidding farewell to a career after achieving your goals is an emotional moment. I would like to thank both Rohit and Virat for their contributions to the team, their incredible innings, and the records they set,‚Äù he added.
Article Summary: Mohammed Shami has finally addressed the swirling rumours about his supposed marriage to tennis star Sania Mirza. Shami dismissed the rumours and criticized those spreading false information. He also acknowledged the challenge of filling the shoes of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli from T20Is.

Article Title: Paris Olympics: Flavours of India in Saarbrucken senses
Article Text: SAARBRUCKEN : Tell Dikshant Mehta that the cooking area of the cafeteria at the Sport Campus Saar here smells like an Indian kitchen and the 28-year-old chef from Himachal Pradesh immediately gets defensive. "Kisney bola? Did anyone say anything!" he asks, only assuaged when told that the smells remind one of home so far away.It is cheat day today for the Indian athletes in their final training here.Residing here for over a month for the Paris Olympics scheduled to begin in less than a week's time, the various Indian teams are departing for the French capital in batches, and Mehta, on deputation from SAI for this extended training camp, has decided to whip some Indian flavours as a farewell meal. For today, he severed ties with boxing team nutritionist, Mohit Dhariwal who would zealously oversee the carbs, the calorie count and the protein intake each time Mehta fired up the induction. And so, it's butter chicken and peeli daal for lunch today."The rotis are on demand, mainly for the athletes only," says Mehta, explaining, "The cooking here is done on induction and rotis take a long time, so we usually save it for the athletes."The Indian table tennis that had trained here for over a fortnight left for Paris earlier on Sunday, led by Sharath Kamal - who along with PV Sindhu - will be India's flag bearer at the opening ceremony in Paris. The boxing team, camping here for a month, will leave for Paris on Monday, as will Sindhu - 'PV' in these parts.Apart from the gym in such sports centres, the cafeteria at the Sport Campus Saar gives one the feeling of how the general eating areas of Olympic villages can tend to be - the off-field, off-competition melting pots. At one point 401 athletes from 27 countries from across five continents were training for the Olympics at this sprawling nine-hectare facility. "There are at least two dozen potential Olympic medals floating here at Saarbrucken," a boxing coach with the US team drawled as he watched his higher-weight boxers manhandle the heavy bags.Spending time here, rubbing shoulders with athletes of various disciplines - competitors turned sparring partners turned fellow philosophers and guides - can be an uplifting experience. It can also be a bit distracting, even a bit overwhelming for a first-timer, he felt.On Saturday, 'Anna' Sharath and 'PV' were having a leisurely post-lunch chat. You could overhear snatches of "fitting," and "trial" and "rehearsal" and thus asked if they were discussing the opening ceremony and the flag bearing protocol. "Right now, all we can only think of is 'serve and smash,' both said, almost in unison.Sunday afternoon, under overcast skies and pleasant breeze, saw much activity at the campus. Locals outnumbered the training athletes and crowds and cars lined from well outside the forest area surrounding it. Turns out the crowd was flocking in because home team Germany was playing Brazil for an international volleyball Test match and tickets had been sold out days in advance for the 1000-seater auditorium. Brazil were flying in just for the game, before returning to their training base in France.But the biggest draw for the organisers? 'PV' could also be in attendance since volleyball is like a family heirloom sport, with both her parents being international volleyball players, father Ramana, a fearsome spiker who helped India win the men's bronze at the 1986 Asian Games in Seoul. "I have training, but I think I will put in a little appearance, after all, it's volleyball," Sindhu told TOI.
Article Summary: Dikshant Mehta, on deputation from SAI for this extended training camp, has decided to whip some Indian flavours as a farewell meal. At one point 401 athletes from 27 countries from across five continents were training at this sprawling nine-hectare facility.

Article Title: KL Rahul posts two-word message after being included for Sri Lanka ODIs
Article Text: NEW DELHI: KL Rahul must be feeling the disappointment of missing the flight to the 2024 T20 World Cup. The dashing right-hander had an impressive ODI World Cup last year, scoring 452 runs in 11 matches at an average of 75.33, including one century and two fifties. Despite his performance, he failed to make the India squad for the T20 World Cup, which was won by Rohit Sharma-led Team India .KL Rahul's name wasn't even considered for the five-match T20I series against Zimbabwe, which India won 4-1 under Shubman Gill's captaincy.However, the selectors have included KL Rahul for the three-match ODI series against Sri Lanka, starting August 2 at the R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.On Friday, KL Rahul took to social media and posted a workout video with a two-word message: "More soon."KL Rahul last played an ODI match in December 2023 against South Africa, while his last T20I appearance was against England in November 2022.In 75 ODIs so far, KL Rahul has scored 2,820 runs at an average of 50.35, with 7 centuries and 18 fifties to his name.India will also play three T20Is on the Sri Lanka tour, but KL Rahul has been considered for ODIs only.
Article Summary: KL Rahul has been included in India's ODI squad for the series against Sri Lanka. The right-hander failed to make the India squad for T20 World Cup in 2024. He posted a workout video on social media with the message: "More soon"

Article Title: Why Lucknow SuperGiants 'shared' this Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma photo with Elon Musk
Article Text:
What Virat Kohli told PM Modi

Lucknow SuperGiants official X, formerly Twitter, account recently replied to a post from Tesla CEO and X owner Elon Musk . In a post on X, Musk asked users to share beautiful content. Lucknow Super Giant's social media account replied to the same with a picture from the recent ICC T20 World Cup final, which was played between Indian and South Africa. The Indian team beat South Africa by 7-run to win the World Cup, which ended India's 13-year-long wait for an ICC World Cup trophy."Would be lovely to see more accounts on ùïè simply posting beautiful content x.com/evalovesdesign‚Ä¶," wrote Musk.Quoting this Elon Musk post, Lucknow SuperGiants replied, "Okay done ü•∞," and along with these words shared the picture of Indian cricket team captain Rohit Sharma hugging star batsman Virat Kohli .These pictures of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma hugging are said to have broken the internet. The pictures shared on various social media platforms including X, Instagram and Facebook have got millions of likes.Talking about the hug at the felicitation ceremony, Kohli said "We have been playing for the last 15 years, this is the first time, I see Rohit so emotional - he was crying, I was crying, a hug between both of us - I will never forget that day." The felicitation function was organised by the BCCI at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.Kohli said that winning the T20 World Cup 2024 was a special moment for him as he had not realised the gravity of the moment when he was part of M.S Dhoni's team which won the 2011 ODI World Cup at this same venue. "I was 21-22 at that time and did not realise why the senior players were getting so emotional. After winning this World Cup, I have realised how special this is," said Kohli. He added that he had instantly realised that it was time for him to say goodbye to the format and make way for youngsters.During the Indian team's interaction with Prime Minister Narendra Modi at his residence on July 4, Kohli said, "We lived each ball at the end, we can't explain what was going on inside. We lost hope at one moment, then Hardik took a wicket and then with each ball, we got the energy. I am happy that I was able to contribute to the team in such a big game after a tough time. I won't be able to forget it. I was happy that I was able to take the team to a fighting total."

In a post on X, Musk asked users to share beautiful content.
